content: “preliminary sketch (vorbereitenden Kennzeichung)” of our undertaking (Beginnens) > each metaphysical question always the whole range of metaphysical questions
linkedContent: “preliminary sketch (vorbereitenden Kennzeichung)” of our undertaking (Beginnens) > each metaphysical question always the whole range of metaphysical questions

content: science, submission to beings themselves, gives matter itself explicitly/solely first/last word: beings allowed to reveal themselves > human stance that guides science: irruption by one being called “human being” into whole of beings [Marx’s Gattungswesen]: through this irruption that breaks open beings show what/how they are [?]

content: concession of nothing, always an empty squabble over words? > for science, nothing is an outrage/phantasm (wishes to know nothing about nothing)
linkedContent: concession of nothing, always an empty squabble over words? > for science, nothing is an outrage/phantasm (wishes to know nothing about nothing)

content: “what is the nothing?”: every answer to this question impossible from start; re: nothing, question/answer inherently absurd > nothing is negation of totality of beings, nonbeing pure & simple > the question, the problem, the logic, the problem only devours itself [?] (nur sich selbst verzehrendes Problem ansetzen)
linkedContent: “what is the nothing?”: every answer to this question impossible from start; re: nothing, question/answer inherently absurd > nothing is negation of totality of beings, nonbeing pure & simple > the question, the problem, the logic, the problem only devours itself [?] (nur sich selbst verzehrendes Problem ansetzen)

content: nothing more originary than negation, given > absurdity of question of nothing due to a blind conceit of intellect? > not be misled by formal impossibility > if nothing is to be questioned as we have been questioning it, must be given beforehand [facticity]
linkedContent: nothing more originary than negation, given > absurdity of question of nothing due to a blind conceit of intellect? > not be misled by formal impossibility > if nothing is to be questioned as we have been questioning it, must be given beforehand [facticity]

content: humans tend to seek when they’ve anticipated being at hand, is there a search w/out anticipation (Vorwegnahme), to which pure discovery belongs [totally other]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: humans tend to seek when they’ve anticipated being at hand, is there a search w/out anticipation (Vorwegnahme), to which pure discovery belongs [totally other]

content: [thing in mind, “idea”] try to obtain the nothing as if beings are already obtaining [?] > can never comprehend absolutely whole of beings in themselves, we find ourselves stationed in midst of beings unveiled somehow as whole [how? because Being is presupposed?], no matter how fragmented, we deal w/ beings in unity of the “whole” (even when we cling to particular being [Levinas, face]) > boredom manifests beings as a whole > finding ourselves attuned unveils beings as a whole, fundamental occurrence of our Dasein
linkedContent: [thing in mind, “idea”] try to obtain the nothing as if beings are already obtaining [?] > can never comprehend absolutely whole of beings in themselves, we find ourselves stationed in midst of beings unveiled somehow as whole [how? because Being is presupposed?], no matter how fragmented, we deal w/ beings in unity of the “whole” (even when we cling to particular being [Levinas, face]) > boredom manifests beings as a whole > finding ourselves attuned unveils beings as a whole, fundamental occurrence of our Dasein

content: acquainted w/ nothing in language [cf. “is” method for Being]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

linkedContent: acquainted w/ nothing in language [cf. “is” method for Being]

content: anxiety, attunement to the nothing, not fear > “one feels uncanny,” receding of beings as a whole closes in on us, oppresses us > “anxiety makes manifest the nothing”
linkedContent: anxiety, attunement to the nothing, not fear > “one feels uncanny,” receding of beings as a whole closes in on us, oppresses us > “anxiety makes manifest the nothing”

content: Dasein all that’s still there in anxiety, robs us of speech, because beings as a whole slip away, the nothing crowds around [proof?: I was anxious about nothing]
linkedContent: Dasein all that’s still there in anxiety, robs us of speech, because beings as a whole slip away, the nothing crowds around [proof?: I was anxious about nothing]

content: nothing unveils itself in anxiety, not as being/object
linkedContent: nothing unveils itself in anxiety, not as being/object

content: no annihilation (Vernichtung) of whole of beings takes place in anxiety > nothing doesn’t attract, essentially repelling (abweisend) > nothing itself nihilates (das Nichts selbst nichtet), grants the nothing, not submitted to calculation of annihilation or negation (Verneinung) > nihilation manifests beings in heretofore concealed strangeness as what is radically other (schlechthin Andere) [totally other] re: nothing > originally nihilating nothing brings Dasein, for 1st time, before beings as such—in anxiety original openness of Being

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

content: “in the clear night of the nothing of anxiety the original openness of beings as such arises”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: “in the clear night of the nothing of anxiety the original openness of beings as such arises”

content: Da-sein means: being held out into the nothing > Dasein already beyond beings as whole > such being beyond beings we call transcendence, holding itself out into the nothing, so does/can Dasein adopt a stance toward beings & itself [nihilation of nothing makes possible transcendence of man beyond beings] > w/out nothing, no selfhood, freedom

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: Da-sein means: being held out into the nothing > Dasein already beyond beings as whole > such being beyond beings we call transcendence, holding itself out into the nothing, so does/can Dasein adopt a stance toward beings & itself [nihilation of nothing makes possible transcendence of man beyond beings] > w/out nothing, no selfhood, freedom

content: turn away from nothing into beings: hasten into public superficies of our existence > what testifies (zeugt) to manifestation (Offenbarkeit) of nothing in our existence more than negation? > “not (das Nicht)” more original [?] than negation, negating only one way of nihilating (one way of comporting grounded beforehand in in nihilation of nothing) [annihilation is another way?] > “not” becomes manifest only when nihilation of nothing disengaged from concealment: idea of “logic” disintegrates in turbulence of more originary questioning [has this been proven?]
linkedContent: turn away from nothing into beings: hasten into public superficies of our existence > what testifies (zeugt) to manifestation (Offenbarkeit) of nothing in our existence more than negation? > “not (das Nicht)” more original [?] than negation, negating only one way of nihilating (one way of comporting grounded beforehand in in nihilation of nothing) [annihilation is another way?] > “not” becomes manifest only when nihilation of nothing disengaged from concealment: idea of “logic” disintegrates in turbulence of more originary questioning [has this been proven?]

content: list of more burdensome forms of nothing than negation: unyielding antagonism, stinging rebuke, galling failure, merciless prohibition, bitter privation
linkedContent: list of more burdensome forms of nothing than negation: unyielding antagonism, stinging rebuke, galling failure, merciless prohibition, bitter privation

content: originary anxiety usually repressed (niedergehalten), anxiety is there, is sleeping, its breath quivers perpetually through Dasein > daring ones [embrace] anxiety, sustained by that one which they expend themselves > anxiety [?] stands outside of all opposition [anxiety as indifference point?], there’s cheerfulness, gentleness, creative longing
linkedContent: originary anxiety usually repressed (niedergehalten), anxiety is there, is sleeping, its breath quivers perpetually through Dasein > daring ones [embrace] anxiety, sustained by that one which they expend themselves > anxiety [?] stands outside of all opposition [anxiety as indifference point?], there’s cheerfulness, gentleness, creative longing

content: we’re so finite, we can’t bring ourselves originally before nothing through our own decision/will: our most proper/deepest finitude refuses to yield our freedom
linkedContent: we’re so finite, we can’t bring ourselves originally before nothing through our own decision/will: our most proper/deepest finitude refuses to yield our freedom

content: metaphysics: inquiry beyond or over beings, aims to recover them as a whole for our grasp

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

linkedContent: metaphysics: inquiry beyond or over beings, aims to recover them as a whole for our grasp

content: a history of nothing: from Greek [?] ex nihilo nihil fit (from nothing, nothing comes to be) to Christian dogma ex nihilo fit—ens creatum (from nothing comes—created being) (nothing indicates fundamental conception of beings [here, as counterconcept to summum ens, God as ens increatum?]) > God & nothing [Augustine]

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

linkedContent: a history of nothing: from Greek [?] ex nihilo nihil fit (from nothing, nothing comes to be) to Christian dogma ex nihilo fit—ens creatum (from nothing comes—created being) (nothing indicates fundamental conception of beings [here, as counterconcept to summum ens, God as ens increatum?]) > God & nothing [Augustine]

content: nothing awakens for 1st time proper formulation of metaphysical question re: Being of beings > nothing not as indeterminate opposite of beings, unveils itself as belonging to Being of beings > agrees w/ Hegel’s “Pure Being and pure Nothing are therefore the same” [also quoted in HDG.BC]

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

linkedContent: nothing awakens for 1st time proper formulation of metaphysical question re: Being of beings > nothing not as indeterminate opposite of beings, unveils itself as belonging to Being of beings > agrees w/ Hegel’s “Pure Being and pure Nothing are therefore the same” [also quoted in HDG.BC]

content: Being is finite [?] > nothing & Being belong together [are the same] because being itself is essentially finite, manifests itself only in transcendence of a Dasein held out into the nothing

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

linkedContent: Being is finite [?] > nothing & Being belong together [are the same] because being itself is essentially finite, manifests itself only in transcendence of a Dasein held out into the nothing

content: presumed soberness of mind, superiority of science: laughable when doesn’t take nothing seriously > it’s only because nothing is manifest that science can make beings themselves objects of investigation > new task of science (its essential task) to exist on basis of metaphysics, disclose entire expanse of truth in nature & history [?]
linkedContent: presumed soberness of mind, superiority of science: laughable when doesn’t take nothing seriously > it’s only because nothing is manifest that science can make beings themselves objects of investigation > new task of science (its essential task) to exist on basis of metaphysics, disclose entire expanse of truth in nature & history [?]

content: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks

linkedContent: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks

content: for philosophy to get underway: 1) allow space for beings as a whole 2) release ourselves into the nothing, liberate ourselves from idols 3) let sweep of our suspense (Schwebens) take its full course, so it swings back to fundamental question of metaphysics [possibility of “why” makes it possible to ground things > destiny of our existence placed in hands of researcher (Forschers) (Nietzsche)] [destiny, question, ground of metaphysics, beyond metaphysics]
